content: अभिमानः {@--1@} Pride(in a good sense), self-respect, honourable or worthy feeling; सदाभिमानैकधना हि मानिनः <ls>Śi. 1. 67</ls>; <ls>Bh. 3. 5</ls>; अभिमानधनस्य गत्वरैः <ls>Ki. 2. 19</ls>; संकल्पयोनेरभिमानभूतं <ls>Ku. 3. 24.</ls> {@--2@} Self-conceit, pride, arrogance, haughtiness, egotism, high-opinion of oneself; शिथिल°नाः संवृत्ताः <ls>M. 2</ls>, <ls>Bh. 3. 46</ls>, <ls>Bg. 16. 4</ls>; °वत् proud, conceited. {@--3@} Referring all objects to self, the act of अहंकार, personality, misconception (मिथ्याज्ञानं), see अहंकार. {@--4@} Conceit, conception; supposition, belief, opinion; <ls>Ki. 13. 7.</ls> {@--5@} Knowledge, consciousness (बुद्धि, ज्ञान); साधारण्याभिमानतः <ls>S. D.</ls> {@--6@} Affection, love. {@--7@} Desire, wishing for. {@--8@} Laying claim to. {@--9@} Injury, killing, seeking to injure. {@--10@} A sort of state occasioned by love.
